entry.title: Bridge returned error 400! (18692)
entry.content:
Twitter @leslieherod was unable to receive or process the remote website's content!
Error message: `The requested resource cannot be found!
Please make sure your input parameters are correct!
cUrl error: (0)
PHP error: `
Query string: `action=display&bridge=Twitter&context=By+username&u=leslieherod&norep=on&nopic=on&noimg=on&format=Atom`
Version: `dev.2020-02-26`

  • Press Return to check your input parameters
  • Press F5 to retry
  • Check if this issue was already reported on GitHub (give it a thumbs-up)
  • Open a GitHub Issue if this error persists

pmaziere

entry.title: "'It was the absolute perfect time,' Reis...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"'It was the absolute perfect time,' Reis explained, as Polis asked to marry him. 'I said to him: ‘I couldn’t breathe before. Now I really can’t breathe’.'
Thankfully, he caught his breath and said yes."

PinkNews

Colorado governor Jared Polis's partner proposed to him moments before being carted off to hospital with the coronavirus.

pinknews.co.uk

US governor proposed to boyfriend as he was being rushed to hospital with COVID

Colorado governor Jared Polis's partner proposed to him moments before being carted off to hospital with the coronavirus.Colorado governor Jared Polis's partner proposed to him moments before being carted off to hospital with the coronavirus.

entry.content:

entry.title: "The economic crisis precipitated by the pandemic has only...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"The economic crisis precipitated by the pandemic has only fueled an existing eviction catastrophe. Today, nearly 18 million households have little or no confidence in their ability to pay the rent, [...] and landlords have filed hundreds of thousands of evictions during the pandemic despite the federal eviction moratorium."

The Appeal

Addressing extreme housing precarity requires more than rental assistance; it requires an overhaul of the system and redress of the longstanding discriminatory housing policies that led to this moment.

theappeal.org

The American Eviction Crisis, Explained

Addressing extreme housing precarity requires more than rental assistance; it requires an overhaul of the system and redress of the longstanding discriminatory housing policies that led to this moment.Addressing extreme housing precarity requires more than rental assistance; it requires an overhaul of the system and redress of the longstanding discriminatory housing policies that led to this moment.

entry.title: "U.S. Census survey data shows that about a quarter of...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"U.S. Census survey data shows that about a quarter of Colorado renters — some 181,000 households — have slight or no confidence they can make rent without aid. But the rental housing industry argues that stories like Nichols’ are evidence that the state is doing OK when it comes to managing the housing insecurity crisis."

The Denver Post

Like roughly nine in 10 Coloradans, Whitney Nichols makes the rent every month. U.S. Census survey data shows that about a quarter of Colorado renters — some 181,000 households — have s…

Coalition of Colorado Democrats wants to strip power from landlords and hand it to tenants instead

entry.title: "Louise Carr, 50 and divorced, lost her job as a baker and...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Louise Carr, 50 and divorced, lost her job as a baker and waitress early on in the pandemic when the Castle Rock cafe where she worked closed its doors. Now she’s vying with 20-somethings for work in a juice bar, and she’s losing."

The Colorado Sun

Louise Carr, 50 and divorced, lost her job as a baker and waitress early on in the pandemic when the Castle Rock cafe where she worked closed its doors. Now she’s vying with 20-somethings for work in a juice bar, and she’s losing. Laura Charlton, 51, watched her self-made massage therapy busines...

coloradosun.com

Coronavirus crushed Colorado’s economy. But working women paid the highest price.

Louise Carr, 50 and divorced, lost her job as a baker and waitress early on in the pandemic when the Castle Rock cafe where she worked closed its doors. Now she’s vying with 20-somethings for work in a juice bar, and she’s losing. entry.title: "The spike has made public safety a central issue in an...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"The spike has made public safety a central issue in an upcoming mayoral election. But in a city that’s been reckoning with racial justice since the police murder of Michael Brown in nearby Ferguson seven years ago, many are saying that ramping up policing isn’t the answer."

The Appeal

Instead of expanding the "arrest, prosecute, and incarcerate model," advocates want the next mayor to address the root causes of violence.

theappeal.org

Policing and Public Safety at Odds in St. Louis Mayoral Race

Instead of expanding the "arrest, prosecute, and incarcerate model," advocates want the next mayor to address the root causes of violence.Instead of expanding the "arrest, prosecute, and incarcerate model," advocates want the next mayor to address the root causes of violence.

entry.title: "Former Louisiana Supreme Court Chief Justice Bernette...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Former Louisiana Supreme Court Chief Justice Bernette Johnson’s fiery dissents on mass incarceration and sentencing in America’s most carceral state garnered international attention. But the rise of the first Black woman on the court was characterized by one battle after another with the Deep South’s white power structure."

The Appeal

But the rise of the first Black woman on the court was characterized by one battle after another with the Deep So...

entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

entry.title: "[It] is quickly evolving. We've made bold changes ......
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"[It] is quickly evolving. We've made bold changes ... and people are using this momentum that was created this past year to make change not only through the political process, but also in their own places of work, their homes, their schools and our community." - State House Representative Leslie Herod

Former Mayor Wellington Webb is "inspired by the coalition of young people and races that have come together to fight."

axios.com

"We have a lot of work to do": Key leaders reflect on the state of Denver's Black community

Former Mayor Wellington Webb is "inspired by the coalition of young people and races that have come together to fight."Former Mayor Wellington Webb is "inspired by the coalition of young people and races that have come together to fight."

entry.title: "A bill that holds funding steady for Colorado schools...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"A bill that holds funding steady for Colorado schools despite a pandemic-related drop in enrollment passed the state Senate unanimously Friday."

The Colorado Sun

A bill that holds funding steady for Colorado schools despite a pandemic-related drop in enrollment passed the state Senate unanimously Friday. Colorado funds its schools on a per-pupil basis, and lawmakers could have held back millions promised to schools after the October student tally recorded ne...

coloradosun.com

Colorado lawmakers advance effort to maintain school funding despite enrollment declines

A bill that holds funding steady for Colorado schools despite a pandemic-related drop in enrollment passed the state Senate unanimously Friday. entry.title: "A new timeline and grouping for COVID-19 vaccines, Phase...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"A new timeline and grouping for COVID-19 vaccines, Phase 1B.4, is scheduled to start around March 21 and people 50 or older will be among the vaccinated, according to the state. The new phase, announced Friday by Gov. Jared Polis, is expected to vaccinate about 2.5 million Coloradans."

The Denver Post

A new timeline and grouping for COVID-19 vaccines, Phase 1B.4, is scheduled to start around March 21 and people 50 or older will be among the vaccinated, according to the state.

denverpost.com

COVID-19 vaccine in Colorado: Who is eligible in phase 1B.4 starting around March 21?

A new timeline and grouping for COVID-19 vaccines, Phase 1B.4, is scheduled to start around March 21 and people 50 or older will be among the vaccinated, according to the state.A new timeline and grouping for COVID-19 vaccines, Phase 1B.4, is scheduled to start around March 21 and people 50 or older will be among the vaccinated, according to the state.

entry.title: Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have community support for this work. We all have a story to tell. Our stories are our strength and our voices will be heard.

"Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.”

- 5280 Magazine

...

📸 Paul Miller Photography
Hair: Dornise LaTone Afhair
Styling: LILFRESHSAM

See MoreForget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.
